page.title: 16Paris Farm - East Malling
page.content: Paris farm,covering 140 acres, is one of the best-known farms in the area. During the "Pick your own" season, it is always AA signposted. Fruit crops grown are strawberries, raspberries, gooseberries, apples, pears and plums. Vegetables include broad & French beans, cauliflower, spring greens, marrows, curly kale, courgettes, marrows, calabrese and rhubarb. One full-time and three casual workers are employed. During the summer, between 10 and 20 pickers are employed. Lately there has been a shortage of pickers. Produce goes to supermarkets, whole - salers and retailers. There is a farm shop but many people prefer "pick your own". 1985 has not been a good year for crops. Frost in Jan-Feb killed many of the vegetables. A wet June damaged the strawberries - they ripened too slowly or rotted.
